# hasActiveTextSelection

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether a person or the app has text selected within the image.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor final var hasActiveTextSelection: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

If [doc://com.apple.VisionKit/documentation/VisionKit/ImageAnalysisOverlayView/InteractionTypes/textSelection] is an active interaction type, a person can select text using a standard input method and the app can select text through the [doc://com.apple.VisionKit/documentation/VisionKit/ImageAnalysisOverlayView/selectedRanges] property. If neither a person nor the app select any text, then this property returns `false`.

## Accessing text information

- **text**: The text contents of the current image analysis.
- **selectedText**: The current selected text.
- **selectedAttributedText**: The current selected attributed text.
- **analysisHasText(at:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the analysis finds text at the specified point.
- **hasText(at:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether active text exists at the specified point.
- **hasDataDetector(at:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the analysis detects data at the specified point.
